Articles.Content:
So yeah, it\'s a copy of the space shuttle. Demonstrates the new part rotation in the Spaceplane Hangar, which, incidentally, allows you to build things horizontally then launch them vertically by rotating the command pod. Or build parts of them upside down. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> ![screenshot48gd.png](http://img28.imageshack.us/img28/5519/screenshot48gd.png)
>

> 
> 

If only it could get into orbit... ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

It\'s a bit tricky to get to fly, one needs to turn on the ASAS, RCS and apply full throttle for takeoff, but keep an eye on the roll, because as fuel runs out and atmospheric conditions change it tends to wobble.

EDIT: If anybody can get this thing to land in one piece, powered or unpowered, you get a medal. I have yet to figure out a way to land it except in lots of little bits.
To land that thing in larger bits (preferably only one), you might have to put a canard on it. It\'s hard to effectively flare without one.
I know, but I didn\'t want to mess up the design... I might see if I can fit a canard inside the nose so you can\'t see it.. hmm

Okay, new version, This one has minimal canards. I managed to glide it horizontally at 20m/s vertical speed, I\'m not sure if it could land at that speed however, so MOAR WHEELS. Fitted with drag chute and emergency chute, just in case. Also, all engines fire on take-off. I managed to get it halfway out the atmosphere before it ran out of fuel ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
